descriptionSet.description: In this image the Prince of Wales is listening to a native band playing several types of instruments while visiting Poonah in Maharashtra. The prince is holding his palm behind his ear and is dressed in a royal uniform with medals on his jacket and a hat. There are some people squatting on the ground and looking towards him. One of them can be seen using the hand gesture (salaam) to salute him while another can be seen with folded hands (namaste). Most of the men are wearing turbans. A woman with a baby and another woman who has a sari draped over her head and covering most of her face can also be seen. In the background some plants and the painting or wall hanging of a tiger can also be seen.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: S.P. Hall Prince of Wales 1876

description-en: In this image the Prince of Wales is listening to a native band playing several types of instruments while visiting Poonah in Maharashtra. The prince is holding his palm behind his ear and is dressed in a royal uniform with medals on his jacket and a hat. There are some people squatting on the ground and looking towards him. One of them can be seen using the hand gesture (salaam) to salute him while another can be seen with folded hands (namaste). Most of the men are wearing turbans. A woman with a baby and another woman who has a sari draped over her head and covering most of her face can also be seen. In the background some plants and the painting or wall hanging of a tiger can also be seen. (sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: The Indians in the picture have been depicted with very strong expressions. Some of them look almost angry. The illustration has very strong stereotypical and colonial undertones. The word 'Shahzada' translates to 'crown prince'. 'Poonah' is the old spelling of Pune, an important city in Maharashtra. (sp)
related hyperlinks: http://www.irfca.org/docs/history/prince-of-wales.html, last accessed on 2011-08-01, Details about the Prince of Wales visit to Bombay, Pune and other places (sp)
